title: Favorite Children's Show
question_text:
An executive at a streaming service is surveying parent's on what show is their children's favorite on their app. The data is summarized in the graph below.
Which of the following statements is supported by the bar chart?

choices.text: Bubble Guppies was selected more than Paw Patrol.
The data is not accurate because the percentages do not add to be 100%.
Bluey and Bubble Guppies account for more than half of the responses.
Bluey was answered more than the other two shows combined.
The data is invalid because they didn't offer an "Other" category.

solution:
Solution

The Bar Chart is a visual representation of a Categorical Variable. In this case, the Categorical Variable would be the children's favorite tv show. The height of the bar corresponds to the percent of children that answered the tv show.

Bluey was selected 40%
of the time, while Bubble Guppies was selected 25%
of the time. Therefore, they account for 65%
of the data, which is more than half.

Choice 'C' is correct.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect. Bubble Guppies relative frequency is less than Paw Patrol, so Bubble Guppies was not selected more than Paw Patrol.

Choice 'B' is incorrect. The percentages do add up to be
100
%
, which makes the table valid.

Choice 'D' is incorrect. Bluey was only selected
40
%
, which means the other two add to be
60
%
.

Choice 'E' is incorrect. The researcher used the shows on their site, therefore he does not need to offer an "Other Category".
